intro: Wendlandia guangdongensis, commonly known as the Guangdong bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
